meanings.definition: To move rapidly with a whirring sound.
meanings.sent1: The leaves skirr in the wind.
meanings.sent2: I heard the bicycle skirr past me.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made the acorns skirr across the roof.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to skirr by as we raced to finish the project.
meanings.sent5: The skirring of the car tires on the wet road echoed in the night.

meanings.sent1: The skirr of the old fan filled the room.
meanings.sent2: The skirr of the machinery could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The skirr of the rusty gate made me jump.
meanings.sent4: The skirr of the violin strings added a haunting quality to the music.
meanings.sent5: The skirr of the cicadas in the trees created a peaceful background noise.
